title: Doubtful contamination in a private place
vignette: A piece of food may have touched something contaminated in a dark room.

options.text: Assume cleanliness since it was not witnessed.
Treat it as contaminated out of caution.

title: Vessel sealed with a tight lid
vignette: A pot is sealed and then enters a room containing hazardous material.

options.text: Contents remain clean under the seal.
Everything in the room becomes contaminated regardless.

title: Food touched by uncertain hands
vignette: A stranger may or may not have washed before handling produce.

options.text: Assume contaminated until proven otherwise.
Rely on the presumption of cleanliness.

title: Split loaf contacting liquid
vignette: Part of a loaf falls into juice, connecting to the rest still dry.

options.text: The whole loaf can transmit contamination now.
Only the wet portion is susceptible.

title: Utensils touching mid-level contamination
vignette: A utensil touches another item that was already second-degree contaminated.

options.text: It becomes third-degree and still problematic.
Lower levels do not transfer further.

title: Preparing clean food on a questionable surface
vignette: The table might have been touched by children who played in the dirt.

options.text: Wipe the surface and proceed; assume cleanliness.
Consider the food contaminated unless the table was guarded.

title: Two loaves meet in mid air
vignette: A clean loaf is tossed and briefly touches a contaminated one before being caught.

options.text: The clean loaf becomes contaminated from contact.
Momentary contact is negligible; it remains clean.

title: Stacked fruits with liquid seeping
vignette: Grapes ooze onto figs beneath them in a basket.

options.text: All fruit may transmit contamination through the juice.
Only the wetted figs become susceptible.

title: Partial immersion due to small sanitization bath
vignette: A person immerses in a pool that lacks the required volume.

options.text: Immersion is invalid; repeat in a proper sanitization bath.
Count it if most of the body was submerged.

title: Spilled certified oil touching normal produce
vignette: Certified oil drips onto ordinary vegetables.

options.text: The vegetables become restricted and require cleanliness.
Simply wipe them; status does not change.

title: Child carrying clean liquids
vignette: A youngster assigned to bring clean wine may have touched insects en route.

options.text: Assume contamination due to lack of caution.
Trust the child unless evidence shows contact.

title: Seal breaks on a jug after immersion
vignette: A sealed jug was sanitized but its stopper loosened later.

options.text: It remains clean despite the later break.
New exposure renders it contaminated.

title: Bread touched by doubtfully contaminated hands
vignette: Workers unsure of their cleanliness handled bakery loaves.

options.text: Treat the bread as second-degree contaminated.
Assume cleanliness and sell as usual.

title: Water drawn with a questionable bucket
vignette: The bucket might have touched hazardous material before use.

options.text: Consider the water contaminated and discard.
Water remains clean unless contact is certain.

title: Handling produce after sweating heavily
vignette: A worker handles regulated produce while perspiring heavily from labor.

options.text: Sweat counts like liquid making them susceptible.
Sweat is not considered a significant liquid here.
